text:
Linux under kernel 2.4.x no longer has a 2GB file limit, though Apache still 
has this limitation and will not log to a logfile that is larger than 2GB.  I 
originally reported this on the RedHat Bugzilla page and they requested I post 
an RFE here for the fix.  See the attached link for details on the bug and 
RedHat's replies.

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=62712
creator: ctolley@datareturn.com

text:
According to Red Hat, Apache 2.0 is also affected by this restriction.

I hope that this problem can be fixed, because there is a real possibility of
this causing a denial of service.
creator: warren@togami.com

text:
Apache 1.3 makes the assumption that the maximum file size is determined by a
signed 32bit int. It is unlikely that this will be fixed or addressed under the
1.3 tree, but I will keep it open
creator: jim@apache.org
